intro: Mammillaria caracassana, commonly known as the Caracassana nipple cactus, is a species native to Mexico. It is a small, spineless cactus with a globular shape and a dense covering of white, woolly hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and slow growth, it is a popular choice among cactus enthusiasts.
